column4: can anyone help with figuring out why my laptop runs hot in 10.10? i dont remember this being a problems in earlier version
Open your system monitor and see if something's hogging the CPU
nothing is using CPU. its constantly 60 degrees or higher http://i.imgur.com/puIJl.jpg
Laptops tend to build up dust and dirt inside, which can slow down fans, thermally insulate hardware, etc. Maybe you need to to get some canned air or a compresser and blow the dust out
or...
g_0_0: i actually just took this whole laptop apart to replace the hinges. inside was pretty clean and im pretty sure it started after moving to 10.10
Maybe your CPU is on "performance"?
where do i set that?
Easiest way to set it is to put a CPUFreq applet on your panel for each core.
it's set to on demand
should i try conservative?
Go for it
Though at 97% idle, it shouldn't make a difference...
doesnt seem to be helping, man this has been driving me nuts for months
also, it doesnt run hot it windows
What is your current/max CPU freq?
where do i see that?
If you have that CPUFreq applet, hover over to see current, click to see a list of possivle Frequencies
possible*
it says 1GHz but goes up to 2GHz, but is set to ondemand setting
I can see no reason for your computer to run hot, then
Unless it's your GPU causing the heat
But with 97% idle on CPU, that's unlikely.
yeah me neither. ive been trying to figure it out for months. i have compiz and everything disabled, its intel graphics
